intro.speaker: Nealuchi
intro.line: Oh my! If it isn't young Prince Serenes! Welcome, welcome, welcome.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Nealuchi, you're looking well.

intro.speaker: Nealuchi
intro.line: And feeling well, too, thank you very much. This old crow's as spry as ever. Hee hee!...Tell me though. How fares your father, King Lorazieh?

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: The same as ever. Since that terrible day, he remains abed... He seldom rises anymore.

intro.speaker: Nealuchi
intro.line: Mmm... I'm not surprised. In the span of a few days, he lost his family, his friends, and almost all of his countrymen.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Yes...

intro.speaker: Nealuchi
intro.line: And yet, we're blessed that you are still with us! Prince Reyson, if there's anything this doddering old bird can do for you, please do not hesitate to ask.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Thank you. I appreciate your kind sentiment.

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: Sorry to have kept you waiting, Reyson. Nealuchi! You can talk ancient history later. Leave us at once.

intro.speaker: Nealuchi
intro.line: Yes, yes, of course. I'm sure you've much to talk about, much to say. I'll just take my leave of you...Please, Prince Reyson. Make yourself at home.

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: Hmph! Old Nealuchi's always been fond of House Serenes. When he heard the White Prince himself was gracing us with a visit, he could barely contain his joy. So, Prince. What's this all about? We haven't seen your face around here in a long time, and I'm naturally quite curious as to your intentions.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Your attitude during the Goldoa meeting piqued my interest. What is it you're after, Naesala? Why do you provoke Tibarn?

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: You came all this way for that? Are you serious?

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Do not mock me, crow king! Tibarn is my father's guardian. If not for him, we might have suffered the end of House Serenes itself. I will not brook any insults to him.

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: Oh, I see. So rather than ally yourself with me, your trusted companion of old, you would side with this new protector? That's an unfortunate shift in attitude. I trust you remember that when you and your sister were young, it was I, and not Tibarn, who watched over you?

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Any change in my bearing can be laid at your roost, Naesala. After all...you, my old friend, are the one who continues to engage in commerce with my enemy. With humans. If you were to change your ways, I'm sure we could rebuild the relationship the two of us once shared.

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: Oh no, that I could never do. You see, humans are essential to the fulfillment of my ambitions.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: ...You've changed, Naesala. If this is the path you've chosen, I've nothing left to say.

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: ...I doubt you could ever understand what it means to guard Kilvas, Prince. To protect an entire country.

intro.speaker: Raven Laguz
intro.line: King Naesala! Duke Tanas of the Begnion Imperial Senate has arrived.

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: Bring him in.

intro.speaker: Oliver
intro.line: Your Majesty! J-just now, I brushed against the most splendid specimen! W-was that a Serenes noble? They're supposed to be extinct!

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: And what if it were?

intro.speaker: Oliver
intro.line: Oh, I was right! Wonderful! My eyes did not deceive me. Those dazzling white wings. And that shimmering hair, sparkling like falling gold dust...That is the crystallization of beauty in its purest form--

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: Duke Oliver, can we please discuss the business at hand? Per your request, we have appropriated several pieces of art from the ships of Duke Gaddos.

intro.speaker: Oliver
intro.line: Yes, yes, and you will be compensated as promised. But right now there is...something else that I simply must have.

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: Really? Another request? What can we purloin for you today? More art, perhaps?

intro.speaker: Oliver
intro.line: Oh ho! Something much more stunning. And if you agree to my proposition, I will double your normal fee!

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: That is a most generous offer. Tell me, what is it you desire?

intro.speaker: Oliver
intro.line: Desire? But surely you've already guessed...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Meeting with the apostle was fine, but all she did was pay us and give us another job. She answered no questions.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: I wonder what she's planning. That cargo... I can't help but believe that there were living creatures inside, but...What do you suppose the apostle intends to do with them?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I don't know. Titania, are all nobles and royals like this? They have plans and paperwork for every little thing, and their speech is as confusing as it is tedious.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: But, Ike, the other nobles we know are different! There's Princess Elincia, and King Gallia, and the dragon prince, too! All of them have been so nice and friendly and easy to talk to.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Perhaps the rudeness of the upper echelon is unique to the beorc class system. Princess Elincia was raised in special circumstances. Maybe that's why she's so different.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Bah! I could never get accustomed to the culture of beorc nobles.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Tell me, Soren, are you all right?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Hm?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Recently--ever since we reached Begnion, in fact--you've seemed depressed.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Is...is that so? How odd. Well, I can think of nothing specific that's bothering me.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Well, if you say so.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So, it's time for the desert! Which is the best direction to enter from?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Soren?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: ...Eh? Yes, what is it?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: All right, I know there's something going on!

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: I'm... I'm sorry... I was...thinking. What is it you wanted?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Well, I was going to ask you for directions, but it's no longer necessary. It looks like we're being met.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Ah!

intro.speaker: Tormod
intro.line: Who are you? Answer me!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We're mercenaries. We were hired to take care of a group of bandits operating in this area.

intro.speaker: Tormod
intro.line: More of the senators' dogs! You cast us as thieves so you can murder us and hide your guilt! But we will not be defeated! Mark my words! The day will come when all slaves are free, and then you will pay for your crimes!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What on earth are you talking about?

intro.speaker: Tormod
intro.line: No more useless words! Come, my brothers! Take them!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What? We're facing laguz? I don't like the look of this!

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Laguz or no, it doesn't change the fact that they are brigands. Do not lower your guard!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I know what I'm doing. Everyone! Watch your footing in this sand. Take care and fight well!

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: Sniff... Hm?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: I...sense...something...

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: ...Grrrr...Must be my imagination...

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: A female cat! Splendid! I've not seen your face in these parts before.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: Aaaah! Wh-where...Where did you come from?

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: Oh, I see that I've startled you. My apologies.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: Who are you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: If you wish to learn someone's name, isn't it polite to introduce yourself first?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: Grrr... I am...Lethe. From Gallia.

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: And I...am Stefan! I live here in this desolate wasteland, playing at being a hermit.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: Is that so? Well, don't let me interrupt your...life.

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: Oh no! Please don't worry about it.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: Oh, I won't.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: ...And?

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: What?

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: Why are you standing there staring at me? I'm interested in Gallia's beast tribes. Fascinating, really. I have an idea! Can we go somewhere and talk?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: ...I don't think so.

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: Why not?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: My companions and I are in the middle of a battle! I've no time to chitchat with you!

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: Very well... Then I will help you! And once this battle is finished, you'll have time to converse, yes?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: I suppose...perhaps...

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: Right! Off we go then!

recruit-talk.speaker: Lethe
recruit-talk.line: ...What sort of lunatic have I found now?

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: Sniff...

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: Urrrr?

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: Something's...here...Beneath...the sand... Mmmrrr??

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: Nope! I'm over here.

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: So there you are.You are...good at hiding.

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: To be praised by one of the beast tribes is an honor! I am Stefan! I live here in this desolate wasteland, playing at being a hermit. Who are you? I haven't seen you in these parts before.

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: I am Mordecai, a warrior of Gallia. This is the first time I have walked beyond the borders of my country.

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: I thought that might be the case...And I was right. Hoooo! I'm ever so clever!

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: Mordecai, listen here. I'm interested in the beast tribes of Gallia. Would you mind talking with me? I'll buy dinner!

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: Um... My friends and I are fighting, so I...cannot. Sorry.

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: Very well, then! I will help you. Once this battle is finished, you'll have time to converse, yes?

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: All right. If you will fight with us,then I will call Stefan a friend. Later, we will talk about Gallia.

recruit-talk.speaker: Stefan
recruit-talk.line: I'm looking forward to it. Right then, off we go!

recruit-talk.speaker: Mordecai
recruit-talk.line: Yes! Off we go!...Right...then...

visit.speaker: Stefan
visit.line: Oh, look at you! Lost in a place like this... What an odd duck you must be. Hmm...It would be a shame to see you go home empty-handed, though. I will give you this as a memento! Now, in exchange... I ask you to treat our meeting as a dream and let it fade from your memory. And now, I bid thee...farewell!

battle-talk.speaker: Stefan
battle-talk.line: Are you lost, young one? What are you doing in this place?

battle-talk.speaker: Soren
battle-talk.line: What are YOU doing here? Are you with the sub-humans? ...Wait, did you just pop out of the sand?

battle-talk.speaker: Stefan
battle-talk.line: ...Hmm. It seems I made an error.

battle-talk.speaker: Soren
battle-talk.line: What are you talking about? You're not--

battle-talk.speaker: Stefan
battle-talk.line: I was wrong. It's nothing. I've no use for you.

battle-talk.speaker: Stefan
battle-talk.line: It would be a shame to see you go home empty-handed, though. I will give you this as a memento! Now, in exchange... I ask you to treat our meeting as a dream and let it fade from your memory. And now, I bid thee...farewell!

end.speaker: Muarim
end.line: Haah...haa...haa... We lose...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You! You're the leader of this band, aren't you?

end.speaker: Muarim
end.line: Yes...I am. I'll resist you no further. Take me with you or execute me here... I care not. But my companions... Would you let them go? ...Please?

end.speaker: Unknown
end.line: No! I won't allow it!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Huh?

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: I won't let you take Muarim!

end.speaker: Muarim
end.line: Grrr... Stay back, little one! You were not supposed to expose--

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: If you want Muarim, you'll have to kill me first!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You're--

end.speaker: Muarim
end.line: Yes, he is a beorc child. I claimed him when he was little more than an infant. He has nothing to do with us...sub-humans...

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: Stop lying! I'm here because I want to be! Who's the leader of the laguz emancipation army? I am! You're a big jerk, Muarim! Trying to cover for everyone and get yourself killed? I won't allow it!

end.speaker: Muarim
end.line: Little one...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Hey! I don't care who the real leader is.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: A laguz who calls himself a sub-human is protecting a kidnapped beorc who claims to lead a laguz emancipation army? Do I have that right? Because if I do, I have absolutely no idea what any of you are talking about. Would someone please tell me what is going on here?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: All right... Please go over that again. It's been customary throughout Begnion's history to keep laguz as slaves?

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: That's right.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: But that's in the past now! Twenty years ago, all slavery was outlawed, and all laguz were freed!

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: And as far as the general public is concerned, that is exactly what happened.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: So there's a portion of society that willingly breaks the law?

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: The commoners obey, but there are still many laguz slaves in the homes of nobles. Muarim and I brought this to the attention of the senators, but they would not listen. That's why we gathered other fighters. We break into the homes where slaves are kept and help them escape. Of course, the nobles can't let this be known publicly, so they brand us thieves and turn us into wanted outlaws.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: All right. I think I understand your motives,but you're not going to solve the basic problem this way.

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: We know that. But we can't give up and leave them in chains. We can't and won't!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Do you mind if I try to help?

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: Huh?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: This sort of beorc behavior is something that's been bothering me. I think there may be something that I can do...

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Naesala! Stop this foolishness! Where are you taking me? Tell me!

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: It's only a little farther! I'll tell you once we've arrived, just as I promised.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: I left no word with Tibarn. If I had known we were coming this far, I would have left a message...

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Here we are. This is what I wanted to show you. Look below you, Reyson. What do you see?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: What...what is this? How is this possible? What happened here?!

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: This...is Serenes? Is this what you're trying to tell me?! This colorless vista, these cracked and withered branches, these lifeless trees... This is my forest?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: [Sacred trees! Seed, root, and trunk! Awake from your slumber and heed my cry! Answer the call of the green, mighty ones!]

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: ...The ancient tongue. It's been many years since I heard it last. You can still speak it.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: The voice of the forest is still. Why... How did this...

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: It's been like this since your clan's been gone. The area near the entrance is especially bad. They used fire...Most of the trees are dead.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: ...Unforgivable. How...how can they do things like this. Cursed humans... What did this forest do? What did my clan do...

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Humans hold all laguz in contempt. And in the same way, they hold all of nature in contempt as well. They think everything exists for their pleasure and betterment...They are beneath contempt.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Naesala... It appears that I have misjudged you. I called you a groveling toady to humans and labeled you traitor. I was overly harsh. I apologize.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Not to worry. I engage in occasional commerce with humans...That much is true. A more pressing issue is the growing darkness. You can return to Phoenicis tomorrow, can you not? I'm certain that some noble has a villa in this area. At this time of year, it is almost certain to be empty. I suggest we borrow it for the evening.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: You would sleep in a human building?

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Think about it... Bird folk like you and I have no night vision whatsoever. If we were discovered by humans, they would surely overwhelm and capture us, right?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Mmm... I see your point.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Very good. I'll go stumble around until I find something to eat. Please...make yourself comfortable.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Naesala!

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Yes?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Thank you. For everything you've done. I...I appreciate it.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Don't be ridiculous. We're old friends,are we not?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Right you are! Old friend.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Is everything in place?

end.speaker: Raven Laguz
end.line: Yes. That Duke Tanas cannot sit still. He is literally...quivering with anticipation. It's not pretty.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: I bet it isn't. Just make sure that mountain of suet stays hidden. If Reyson catches so much as a glimpse of his bulk, he will take wing.

end.speaker: Raven Laguz
end.line: Understood.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Now, time to put on the finishing touches. This, too, I do to raise up Kilvas. Reyson, please don't judge me too harshly. That being said, I'm sure you will. Ah, well. Such is life. Enjoy your new one... Old friend...

conversation.speaker: Servant
conversation.line: Ahem. You are from the northwest nation of Crimea, are you not? You have my condolences for the terrible misfortune that has befallen your country and people. Yet you remain blessed! Fate has brought you here to the Grand Temple Mainal! To the splendor of Begnion, grandest of all the nations of Tellius. By the way, I hear you are traveling north to the Grann Desert. There are ancient ruins there, you know? They are the remnants of a race known as the Zunanma, who come from a civilization that predates our own. I'm sure you will enjoy the sensation of being immersed in such primordial surroundings!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Um...yeah. It'll be a real picnic.

conversation.speaker: Servant
conversation.line: Oh, yes, picnics are indeed nice. Oh, but a word of caution. Studying the ruins from afar is one thing, but you would be well advised to keep your distance... For safety's sake! It's said that there's a bandit stronghold near the northwest ruins. And we hear occasional reports of strange figures wandering the dunes in the northeast. Be careful!

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: How are your preparations progressing?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: They're underway. We leave within the hour.

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: Your next mission takes you to the Grann Desert. You must choose your companions with care.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: A desert is just a large patch of sandy soil, is it not?

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: Ha ha! With one major difference! Unlike sandy soil, you'll not find solid earth near the surface. You could dig and dig and find only more sand. Those on foot and horseback may find it difficult to move around.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I see. I'm sure that Soren knows much about these things, but...

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: Hmm? Has something befallen master Soren?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I don't know if he's feeling ill or just moping about. It all started when we arrived in Begnion.

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: Oh...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Be that as it may, it won't hurt for me to have this information. Can you tell me more?

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: Of course. There's little water in the desert, and the soil is very dry. Few trees or grasses grow there. Which means there are no groves or anything else which would provide cover. And, as I mentioned before, those on foot or horseback will find the sand slows their pace considerably. The exceptions are magic users, staff wielders, and thieves. Such people will not be affected to so large a degree.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Thieves are agile, so I understand why they would be unaffected. But those skilled in the magical arts? That doesn't make sense.

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: I once heard an explanation from a magic user that I know...He claimed that the spirits he employed flew before him and cleared the sand from his path. However, considering the source, I'm not sure how much of that is truth.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Who was the source?

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: Prime Minister Sephiran.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Would he play a joke like that?

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: Ha ha! Well, the prime minister is a very amusing man. But, please, allow me to continue my explanation. What else...? Others who are unaffected by sand are pegasus knights, wyvern riders, and other flying units. Oh, and laguz, too. Terrain features don't seem to affect them much in either form, although they will be slowed some.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You said laguz, didn't you? Almost everyone here says sub-human.

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: Well, of course. Beorc and laguz are both living things. Every precious life was created to be equal by the blessed goddess. The fact that there are still those who persecute laguz in the land of the goddess... It is deplorable.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: ...Are you of a noble house?

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: Yes, I am. One must be of noble birth to serve the goddess.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: But I thought...that all nobles were half-crazed fools who can't speak the truth. You seem quite honest.

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: Ha ha, I'll take that as a compliment...Oh, and one last thing.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What is it?

conversation.speaker: Sigrun
conversation.line: The desert contains the remnants of more than one lost civilization. Rumor has it that treasures from those times still lie undiscovered beneath the shifting sands. Those with good luck may come across such treasures during battle.

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: Hoooweee! The Grand Temple! Luxury and...gorgeousness as far as the eye can see. If a scoundrel like myself can find employment in a place like this, I guess my luck hasn't abandoned me after all.

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: But...for all the glitter and gold, there's an equal amount of dangerous work. Hmm...That I could do without. Maybe I can use my prone-to-illness ploy...Cough! Yes, I think I can arrange to work about one out of every...five jobs or so! And now that I've a fixed income, it's time to visit the local inns and see what games of chance are about!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Evening.

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: WHAAAA! You... Did you happen to hear any of that?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You were talking out loud. Loudly.

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: Um...I, uh... I wasn't being serious...I am an extremely diligent man! Yes, I am!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Those peddlers you were with...You were in debt to them, right?

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: Huh? How do you know that?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: When we took out that group, your debt vanished...

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: Yes! You're right! That was a tremendous help. Thanks much!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Come now, you can't believe that the world is as forgiving as that. Or that we are so foolish.

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: What?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Debts are debts, and you have many. Those peddlers weren't the only people who were owed coin by you... Right? We can't have debt collectors hounding the company day in and day out. My staff officer repaid the rest of the money you owe.

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: Tha-that's...very kind of you.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: It was from the company coffers. You, my friend, are now in OUR debt. You fight to repay the Greil Mercenaries.

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: Ah! But! Aaah!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Payment will be deducted from your wages. For...quite some time. It seems you're working for free, friend.

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: Oh! I--! Oooh!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Until your debts are completely repaid, don't even think about leaving the company. Or getting sick. Right then! I trust you'll do your best.

conversation.speaker: Makalov
conversation.line: ...What a mess...Awww... Nuts!
